hymns.Title: Praise God, From Whom All Blessings
Praise to the Lord
hymns.Verse 1:
Praise to the Lord, the Almighty, the King of creation!
O my soul, praise Him, for He is thy health and salvation!
All ye who hear, now to His temple draw near;
Join ye in glad adoration!
hymns.Verse 2:
Praise to the Lord, Who o'er all things so wondrously reigneth,
Shieldeth thee under His wings, yea, so gently sustaineth!
Hast thou not seen how thy desires e'er have been
Granted in what He ordaineth?
hymns.Verse 3:
Praise to the Lord, who doth prosper thy work and defend thee;
Surely His goodness and mercy here daily attend thee.
Ponder anew what the Almighty can do,
If with His love He befriend thee.

hymns.Title: New Songs of Celebration Render
hymns.Verse 1:
New songs of celebration render
To Him who has great wonders done.
Love sits enthroned in ageless splendor:
Come, and adore the mighty One.
He has made known His great salvation
Which all His friends with joy confess:
He has revealed to every nation
His everlasting righteousness.
hymns.Verse 2:
Joyfully, heartily resounding,
Let every instrument and voice
Peal out the praise of grace abounding
Calling the whole world to rejoice.
Trumpets and organs, set in motion
Such sounds as make the heavens ring;
All things that live in earth and ocean,
Make music for your mighty King.
hymns.Verse 3:
Rivers and seas and torrents roaring,
Honor the Lord with wild acclaim;
Mountains and stones look up adoring,
And find a voice to praise His name.
Righteous, commanding, ever glorious,
Praises be His that never cease:
Just is our God, whose truth victorious,
Establishes the world in peace.

hymns.Title: My Maker and My King
hymns.Verse 2:
The creature of Thy hand,
On Thee alone I live;
My God, Thy benefits demand
More praise than I can give.
My God, Thy benefits demand
More praise than I can give.
hymns.Verse 4:
O! let Thy grace inspire
My soul with strength divine;
Let every word each desire
And all my days be Thine.
Let every word each desire
And all my days be Thine.

hymns.Title: Let Us Praise the Name of the Lord
hymns.Refrain:
Let us praise the name of the Lord!
Give Him glory, Amen.
hymns.Verse 1:
Go ye into all the world.
Alleluia, Amen.
hymns.Verse 2:
Amen, amen,
Amen, amen.

hymns.Title: All People That on Earth Do Well
hymns.Verse 1:
All people that on earth do dwell,
sing to the Lord with cheerful voice.
Him serve with mirth, his praise forth tell;
come ye before him and rejoice.

hymns.Title: Lord of All Being, Throned Afar
hymns.Verse 1:
Lord of all being, throned afar,
Thy glory flames from sun and star;
Center and soul of every sphere
Yet to each loving heart how near!
Yet to each loving heart how near!
hymns.Verse 2:
Sun of our life, Thy quickening ray
Shed on our path the glow of day;
Star of our hope, Thy softened light
Cheers the long watches of the night,
Cheers the long watches of the night.
hymns.Verse 4:
Lord of all life, below, above
Whose light is truth, whose warmth is love,
Before Thy ever-blazing throne
We ask no luster of our own,
We ask no luster of our own.
hymns.Verse 5:
Grant us Thy truth to make us free
And kindling hearts that burn for Thee;
Till all Thy living altars claim
One holy light, one heavenly flame!
One holy light, one heavenly flame.

hymns.Title: O Sing a New Song to the Lord
hymns.Verse 1:
O sing a new song to the Lord
For marvels He has done;
His right hand and His holy arm
The victory have won.
hymns.Verse 2:
With harp, and voice of psalms
Unto Jehovah sing;
Let trumpets and the echoing horn
Acclaim the Lord our King!
hymns.Verse 3:
Let seas with all their creatures roar,
The world and dwellers there,
And let the rivers clap their hands,
The hills their joy declare.
hymns.Verse 4:
Before the Lord: because He comes,
To judge the earth come He;
He'll judge the world with righteousness,
His folk with equity.

hymns.Title: O Morning Star, How Fair and Bright
hymns.Verse 1:
O Morning Star, how fair and bright!
You shine with God's own truth and light,
Aglow with grace and mercy!
Of Jacob's race, King David's son,
Our Lord and Master,

hymns.Title: O Praise Ye the Lord
hymns.Verse 1:
O praise ye the Lord!
Praise Him in the height;
Rejoice in His word,
Ye angels of light;
Ye heavens, adore Him
By whom ye were made,
And worship before Him,
In brightness arrayed.
hymns.Verse 2:
O praise ye the Lord!
Praise Him upon earth,
In tuneful accord:
Ye sons of new birth;
Praise Him who hath brought
you His grace from above,
Praise Him who hath taught
you To sing of His love.
hymns.Verse 3:
O praise ye the Lord,
All things that give sound;
Each jubilant chord,
Re-echo around;
Loud organs His glory
Forth tell in deep tone,
And sweet harp, the story
Of what He hath done.
hymns.Verse 4:
O praise ye the Lord!
Thanksgiving and song
To Him be outpoured
All ages along:
For love in creation,
For heaven restored.
For grace of salvation,
O praise ye the Lord!

hymns.Title: Immortal, Invisible, God Only Wise
hymns.Verse 1:
Immortal, invisible, God only wise,
In light inaccessible hid from our eyes,
Most blessed, most glorious, the Ancient of Days,
Almighty, victorious, Thy great Name we praise.
hymns.Verse 2:
Unresting, unhasting, and silent as light,
Nor wanting, nor wasting, Thou rulest in might;
Thy justice, like mountains, high soaring above
Thy clouds, which are fountains of goodness and love.
hymns.Verse 4:
Great Father of glory, pure Father of light,
Thine angels adore Thee, all veiling their sight;
All praise we would render; O help us to see
'Tis only the splendor of light hideth Thee!

hymns.Title: God Is Our Song
hymns.Verse 1:
God is our Song, and every singer blest
Who praising Him finds energy and rest.
All who praise God with unaffected joy
Give back to us the widom we destroy,
Give back to us the widom we destroy.
hymns.Verse 2:
God is our Song, for Jesus comes to save;
While praising Him we offer all we have.
New songs we sing, in ventures new unite,
When Jesus leads us upward into light,
When Jesus leads us upward into light.
hymns.Verse 3:
This is our Song no conflict ever drowns;
Who praises God our human wrath disowns.
Love knows what rich complexities of sound
God builds upon a simple common ground,
God builds upon a simple common ground.
hymns.Verse 4:
God is our Silence when no songs are sung,
When ecstasy or sorrow stills the tongue.
Glorious the faith which silently obeys
Until we find again the voice of praise,
Until we find again the voice of praise.

hymns.Title: Now the Joyful Bells A-Ringing
hymns.Verse 1:
Now the joyful bells a-ringing,
All ye mountains, praise the Lord!
Lift our hearts like birds a winging,
All ye mountains, praise the Lord!
Now our festal season bringing
Kinsmen all to bide and board,
Sets our cheery voices singing:
All ye mountains, praise the Lord!
hymns.Verse 2:
Dear our home as dear none other;
Where the mountains praise the Lord!
Gladly here our care we smother;
Where the mountains praise the Lord!
Here we know that Christ our brother
Binds us all as by a cord:
He was born of Mary mother
Where the mountains praise the Lord!
hymns.Verse 3:
Cold the year, new whiteness wearing,
All ye mountains, praise the Lord!
Peace, good will to us abearing,
All ye mountains praise the Lord!
Now we all God's goodness sharing
Break the bread and sheath the sword:
Bright our hearts the signal flaring,
All ye mountains, praise the Lord!

hymns.Title: Every Star Shall Sing a Carol
hymns.Verse 1:
God above, Man below,
Holy is the name I know.
hymns.Verse 2:
Every star shall sing a carol;
Every creatures, high or low,
Come and praise the King of heaven
By whatever name you know.
hymns.Verse 3:
When the King of all creation
Had a cradle on the earth,
Holy was the human body,
Holy was the human birth.
hymns.Verse 4:
Every star and every planet,
Every creature, high or low,
Come and praise the King of heaven
By whatever name you know.

hymns.Title: Praise the Lord, His Glories Show
hymns.Refrain: Alleluia!
hymns.Verse 1:
Praise the Lord, His glories show, Alleluia!
Saints within His courts below, Alleluia!
Angels 'round His throne above, Alleluia!
All that see and share His love, Alleluia!
hymns.Verse 2:
Earth to heaven and heaven to earth, Alleluia!
Tell His wonders, sing His worth, Alleluia!
Age to age and shore to shore, Alleluia!
Praise Him, praise Him evermore! Alleluia!
hymns.Verse 3:
Praise the Lord, His mercies trace, Alleluia!
Praise His providence and grace, Alleluia!
All that He for man hath done, Alleluia!
All He sends us through His Son. Alleluia!

hymns.Title: Praise the Lord! You Heavens Adore Him
hymns.Verse 2:
Praise the Lord! for He is glorious;
never shall His promise fail.
God has made His saints victorious;
sin and death shall not prevail.
Praise the God of our salvation!
hosts on high, His power proclaim.
Heaven and earth and all creation,
laud and magnify His Name.
hymns.Verse 3:
Worship, honor, glory, blessing,
Lord, we offer as our gift.
Young and old, Your praise expressing,
Our glad songs to You we lift.
All the saints in heaven adore You;
we would join their glad acclaim;
As Your angels serve before You,
so on earth we praise Your name.

hymns.Title: Rejoice, Ye Pure in Heart!
hymns.Refrain:
Rejoice, rejoice, rejoice,
Give thanks and sing.
hymns.Verse 1:
Rejoice ye pure in heart!
Rejoice, give thanks, and sing;
Your festal banner wave on high,
The cross of Christ your King.
hymns.Verse 2:
With voice as full and strong
As ocean's surging praise,
Send forth the sturdy hymns of old,
The psalms of ancient days.
hymns.Verse 3:
With all the angel choirs,
With all the saints of earth,
Pour out the strains of joy and bliss,
True rapture, noblest mirth.
hymns.Verse 4:
Yes, on through life's long path,
Still chanting as ye go;
From youth to age, by night and day,
In gladness and in woe.
hymns.Verse 5:
Praise Him who reigns on high,
The Lord whom we adore,
The Father, Son and Holy Ghost,
One God forever more.

hymns.Title: Praise We the Lord
Sing Praise to God
hymns.Verse 1:
Sing praise to God who reigns above,
the God of all creation,
the God of power, the God of love,
the God of our salvation.
With healing balm my soul He fills,
and every faithless murmur stills;
To God all praise and glory!
hymns.Verse 2:
What God's almighty power hath made
His gracious mercy keepeth;
By morning glow or evening shade,
His watchful eye ne'er sleepeth,
Within the kingdom of his might,
Lo! all is just, and all is right:
To God all praise and glory!
hymns.Verse 3:
The Lord is never far away,
throughout all grief distressing,
an ever present help and stay,
our peace and joy and blessing.
As with a mother's tender hand,
He leads His own, His chosen band:
To God all praise and glory!
hymns.Verse 4:
Then all my gladsome way along,
I sing aloud thy praises,
that men may hear the grateful song
my voice unwearied raises:
Be joyful in the Lord, my heart!
both soul and body bear your part!
To God all praise and glory!

hymns.Title: Holy God, We Praise Your Name
hymns.Verse 2:
Hark! the loud celestial hymn
Angel choirs above are raising,
Cherubim and seraphim,
In unceasing chorus praising;
Fill the heavens with sweet accord:
Holy, holy, holy, Lord.

hymns.Title: Tell Out, My Soul
hymns.Verse 3:
Tell out, my soul, the greatness of His might:
Pow'rs and dominions lay their glory by;
Proud hearts and stubborn wills are put to flight,
The hungry fed, the humble lifted high.
hymns.Verse 4:
Tell out, my soul, the glories of His word:
Firm is His promise, and His mercy sure.
Tell out, my soul, the greatness of the Lord
To children's children and forever more.

hymns.Title: When in Our Music God is Glorified
hymns.Refrain: Alleluia! Alleluia!
hymns.Verse 1:
When in our music God is glorified,
And adoration leaves no room for pride,
It is as though the whole creation cried:
Alleluia! Alleluia!
hymns.Verse 2:
How oft, in making music, we have found
A new dimension in the world of sound,
As worship moved us to a more profound
Alleluia! Alleluia!
hymns.Verse 3:
And did not Jesus sing a psalm that night
When utmost evil strove against the light?
Then let us sing for whom He won the fight:
Alleluia! Alleluia!

hymns.Title: Sing a New Song to the Lord
hymns.Verse 1:
Sing a new song to the Lord,
He to whom wonders belong.
Rejoice in His triumph and tell of His power.
O sing a new song to the Lord.
hymns.Verse 2:
Now to the ends of the earth
See His salvation is shown.
And still He remembers His mercy and truth,
Unchanging in love to His own.
hymns.Verse 3:
Sing a new song and rejoice.
Publish His praises abroad.
Let voices in chorus with trumpet and horn,
Resound for the joy of the Lord.
hymns.Verse 4:
Join with the hills and the sea,
Thunders of praise to prolong.
In judgment and justice
He comes to the earth.
O sing a new song to the Lord.

hymns.Title: Wake the Song
hymns.Refrain:
Wake the song, wake the song,
The song of joy and gladness,
Wake the song, wake the song,
The song of Jubilee.
hymns.Verse 1:
Wake the song of joy and gladness;
Hither bring your noblest lays;
Bannish every thought of sadness,
Pouring forth your highest praise.
Sing to Him whose care has brought us
Once again with friends to meet,
And whose loving voice has taught us
Of the way to Jesus' feet.
hymns.Verse 2:
Joyfully with songs and banners,
We will greet the festal day;
Shout aloud our glad hosannas,
And our grateful homage pay.
We will chant our Savior's glory
while our thoughts we raise above,
Telling still the old, old, story,
Precious theme- redeeming love!
hymns.Verse 3:
Thanks to Thee, O holy Father,
For the mercies of the year;
May each heart, as here we gather,
Swell with gratitude sincere,
Thanks to Thee, O loving Savior,
For redemption through Thy blood.
Breathe upon us, Holy Spirit,
Sweetly draw us near to God.

hymns.Title: With Songs and Honors
hymns.Verse 1:
With songs and honors sounding loud,
Address the Lord on high;
Over the heavens He spreads His cloud,
And waters veil the sky.
hymns.Verse 2:
He sends His showers of blessing down
To cheer the plains below;
He makes the grass the mountains crown,
And corning valleys grow.
hymns.Verse 3:
His steady counsels change the face
Of the declining year;
He bids the sun cut short his race,
And wintry days appear.
hymns.Verse 5:
The changing wind, the flying cloud,
Obey His mighty word:
With songs and honors sounding loud
Praise ye the sovereign Lord!

hymns.Title: O Thou in Whose Presence
hymns.Verse 1:
O Thou in whose presence my soul takes delight,
On whom in affliction I call,
My comfort by day and my song in the night,
My hope, my salvation, my all!
hymns.Verse 2:
His voice, as the sound of the dulcimer sweet,
Is heard through the shadows of death;
The cedars of Lebanon bow at His feet,
The air is perfumed with His breath.
hymns.Verse 3:
His lips, as a fountain of righteousness flow,
To water the gardens of grace;
From which their salvation the Gentiles shall know,
And bask in the smiles of His face.
hymns.Verse 4:
He looks, and ten thousands of angels rejoice,
And myriads wait for His word;
He speaks, and eternity, filled with His voice,
Re-echoes the praise of the Lord.

hymns.Title: O Sing, My Soul, Your Maker's Praise
hymns.Verse 1:
O sing my soul, your Maker's praise
In grateful hymns ascending;
Whose steadfast love has crowned your days
With heav'nly gifts un ending.
I sought the Lord, He heard my cry;
His holy angels hover nigh
The tents of those who love Him.
hymns.Verse 2:
The Lord is good to those who seek
His face in time of sorrow,
Providing comfort to the weak
And grace for each tomorrow.
Though grief may tarry for a night,
The morn shall break in joy and light
With blessings from His presence.

hymns.Title: Lord, in the Morning
hymns.Verse 1:
Lord, in the morning Thou shalt hear
My voice ascending high;
To Thee will I direct my prayer,
To Thee lift up mine eye-
hymns.Verse 2:
Up to the hills where Christ is gone
To plead for all His saints,
Presenting at His Father's throne
Our songs and our complaints.
hymns.Verse 3:
O may Thy Spirit guide my feet
In ways of righteousness;
Make every path of duty straight
And plain before my face.
hymns.Verse 4:
The men that love and fear Thy name
Shall see their hopes fulfilled;
The mighty God will compass them
With favor as a shield.

hymns.Title: Arise, My Soul, Arise!
hymns.Refrain: Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!
hymns.Verse 1:
Arise, my soul, arise! Stretch forth to things eternal
And hasten to the feet of your Redeemer God.
Though hid from mortal eyes,
He dwells in light supernal;
Yet worship Him in humbleness and call Him Lord.
His banquet of love Awaits you above;
Yet here He grants a foretaste of the feast to
the feast to come! Rejoice, my soul, rejoice,
To heav'n lift up your voice:
hymns.Verse 2:
Now hear the harps of heav'n!
Oh, hear the song victorious,
The neverending anthem sounding through the sky!
To mortals is not giv'n
To join in strains so glorious;
Yet here on earth we too can sing our praises high!
He bought with His blood The ransomed of God;
To Him be ever lasting pow'r and victory.
And let the great amen
Resound through heav'n again.

hymns.Title: The Dawn of God's Dear Sabbath
hymns.Verse 1:
The dawn of God's dear Sabbath
Breaks o'er the earth again,
As some sweet summer morning
After a night of pain;
It comes as cooling showers
To some exhausted land,
As shade of clustered palm trees
'Mid weary wastes of sand.
hymns.Verse 2:
Lord, we would bring for offering,
Though marred with earthly soil,
A week of earnest labor,
Of steady, faithful toil,
Fair fruits of self denial,
Of strong, deep love to Thee,
Fostered by Thine own Spirit,
In true humility.
hymns.Verse 3:
And we would bring our burden
Of sinful thought and deed,
In Thy pure presence kneeling,
From bondage to be freed,
Our heart's most bitter sorrow
For all Thy work undone-
So many talents wasted!
So few bright laurels won!
hymns.Verse 4:
And with that sorrow mingling,
A steadfast faith, and sure,
And love so deep and fervent,
For Thee to make it pure,
In Thy dear presence finding
The pardon that we need,
And then the peace so lasting-
Celestial peace indeed.

hymns.Title: O Splendor of God's Glory Bright
hymns.Verse 1:
O splendor of God's glory bright,
From light eternal bringing light;
O Light of life, light's living spring,
True day, all days illumining.
hymns.Verse 2:
O Thou true Sun, on us Thy glance
Let fall in royal radiance;
The Spirit's sanctifying beam
Upon our earthly senses stream.
hymns.Verse 3:
O joyful be the passing day
With thoughts as clear as morning's ray,
With faith like noontide shining bright,
Our souls unshadowed by the night.

hymns.Title: When Morning Gilds the Skies
hymns.Verse 1:
When morning gilds the skies my heart awaking cries,
May Jesus Christ be praised!
Alike at work and prayer, to Jesus I repair:
May Jesus Christ be praised!
hymns.Verse 2:
Whene'er the sweet church bell peals over hill and dell,
May Jesus Christ praised!
O hark to what it sings, as joyously it rings,
May Jesus Christ be praised!
hymns.Verse 3:
The night becomes as day when from the heart we say:
May Jesus Christ be praised!
The powers of darkness fear when this sweet chant they hear:
May Jesus Christ be praised!
hymns.Verse 4:
Ye nations of mankind, in this your concord find,
May Jesus Christ praised!
Let all the earth around ring joyous with the sound,
May Jesus Christ praised!
hymns.Verse 5:
In heaven's eternal bliss the loveliest strain is this,
May Jesus Christ praised!
Let earth, and sea and sky from depth to height reply,
May Jesus Christ praised!
hymns.Verse 6:
Be this, while life is mine, my canticle divine:
May Jesus Christ be praised!
Be this th'eternal song through all the ages long,
May Jesus Christ be praised!

hymns.Title: Now That the Daylight Fills the Sky
hymns.Verse 1:
Now that the daylight fills the sky,
We lift our hearts to God on high,
That He, in all we do or say,
Would keep us free from harm today;
hymns.Verse 3:
So we, when this new day is gone
And night in turn is drawing on,
With conscience by the world unstained
Shall praise His name for vict'ry gained.
hymns.Verse 4:
"All praise to You, creator Lord!
All praise to You, eternal Word!
All praise to You, O Spirit wise!"
We sing as daylight fills the skies.

hymns.Title: O Come, O Come, Immanuel
hymns.Refrain: Rejoice! Rejoice! Emmanuel shall come to thee, O Israel.
hymns.Verse1: O come, O come, Emmanuel, And ransom captive Israel, That mourns in lonely exile here Until the Son of God appear.
hymns.Verse2: O come, Thou Wisdom from on high, And order all things far and nigh; To us the path of knowledge show, And cause us in her ways to go.
hymns.Verse3: O come, Desire of nations, bind In one the hearts of all mankind; Bid Thou our sad divisions cease, And be Thyself our King of Peace.

hymns.Title: Of the Father's Love Begotten
hymns.Verse1: Of the Father's love begotten, Ere the worlds began to be, He is Alpha and Omega, He the source, the ending He, Of the things that are, that have been, And that future years shall see, Evermore and evermore! Amen.
hymns.Verse2: O ye heights of heaven adore Him; Angel hosts, His praises sing; Powers, dominions, bow before Him, And extol our God and King; Let no tongue on earth be silent, Every voice in concert ring, Evermore and evermore! Amen.
hymns.Verse3: Christ, to Thee with God the Father And, O Holy Ghost, to Thee, Hymn and chant and high thanksgiving And unwearied praises be. Honor, glory, and dominion, And eternal victory, Evermore and evermore! Amen.

hymns.Title: The Advent of Our God
hymns.Verse1: The advent of our God With eager prayers we greet, And singing haste upon His road His coming reign to meet.
hymns.Verse2: The everlasting Son Was born to make us free; And He a servant's form put on To gain our liberty.
hymns.Verse3: As Judge, on clouds of light, He soon will come again, His scattered people to unite With them in heaven to reign.
hymns.Verse4: Praise to the incarnate Son Who comes to set us free, With Father, Spirit, ever one, To all eternity.

hymns.Title: Go, Tell It On the Mountain
hymns.Refrain: Go, tell it on the mountain, Over the hills and everywhere: Go, tell it on the mountain That Jesus Christ is born!
hymns.Verse1: While shepherds kept their watching O'er silent flocks by night, Behold throughout the heavens There shone a holy light.
hymns.Verse2: The shepherds feared and trembled When lo! Above the earth Rang out the angel chorus That hailed our Savior's birth.
hymns.Verse3: Down in a lowly manger The humble Christ was born, And brought us God's salvation That blessed Christmas morn.

hymns.Title: The First Noel
hymns.Refrain: Noel, Noel, Noel, Noel, Born is the King of Israel
hymns.Verse1: The first noel the angel did say Was to certain poor shepherds in fields where they lay; In fields where they lay keeping their sheep, On a cold winter's night that was so deep.
hymns.Verse2: They looked up and say a star Shining in the east, beyond them far, And to the earth it gave great light, And so it continued both day and night.
hymns.Verse3: And by the light of that same star, Three wise men came from country far, And to the earth it gave great light, And to follow the star wherever it went.

hymns.Title: Angels From the Realms of Glory
hymns.Refrain: Come and worship, Come and worship, Worship Christ, the newborn King.
hymns.Verse1: Angels from the realms of glory, Wing your flight o'er all the earth; Ye, who sang creation's story, Now proclaim Messiah's birth;
hymns.Verse2: Shepherds, in the field abiding, Watching o'er your flocks by night, God with man is now residing; Yonder shines the Infant Light;
hymns.Verse3: Sages, leave your contemplations, Brighter visions beam afar; Seek the great Desire of nations; Ye have seen His natal star;

hymns.Title: There's a Song in the Air
hymns.Verse1: There's a song in the air! There's a star in the sky! There's a mother's deep prayer And a baby's low cry! And the star rains its fire while the beautiful sing, For the manger of Bethlehem cradles a King!
hymns.Verse2: There's a tumult of joy O'er the wonderful birth, For the virgin's sweet boy Is the Lord of the earth. Aye! the star rains its fire while the beautiful sing, For the manger of Bethlehem cradles a King!
hymns.Verse3: In the light of that star Lie the ages impearled; And that song from afar Has swept over the world. Every hearth is aflame and the beautiful sing In the homes of the nations that Jesus is King!

hymns.Title: Hark! the Herald Angels Sing
hymns.Verse1: Hark! the herald angels sing, 'Glory to the new born King, peace on earth, and mercy mild, God and sinners reconciled!' Joyful, all ye nations rise, join the triumph of the skies; with th' angelic host proclaim, 'Christ is born in Bethlehem!'
hymns.Verse2: Christ, by highest heaven adored; Christ, the everlasting Lord; late in time behold him come, offspring of a virgin's womb. Veiled in flesh the Godhead see; hail th' incarnate Deity, pleased with us in flesh to dwell, Jesus, our Emmanuel.
hymns.Verse3: Hail the heaven-born Prince of Peace! Hail the Sun of Righteousness! Light and life to all he brings, risen with healing in his wings. Mild he lays his glory by, born that we no more may die, born to raise us from the earth, born to give us second birth.

hymns.Title: As With Gladness Men of Old
hymns.Verse1: As with gladness men of old Did the guiding star behold, As with joy they hailed its light, Leading onward, beaming bright, So, most gracious Lord, may we Evermore be led to Thee.
hymns.Verse2: As with joyful steps they sped To that lowly manger bed, There to bend the knee before Him whom heav'n and earth adore, So may we with willing feet Ever seek Thy mercy seat.
hymns.Verse3: As they offered gifts most rare At that manger rude and bare, So may we with holy joy, Pure, and free from sin's alloy, All our costliest treasures bring, Christ, to Thee our heav'nly King.

hymns.Title: Away in a Manger
hymns.Verse1: Away in a manger, no crib for a bed, The little Lord Jesus laid down his sweet head. The stars in the sky looked down where he lay, The little Lord Jesus asleep in the hay.
hymns.Verse2: The cattle are lowing, the baby awakes, But little Lord Jesus no crying he makes. I love Thee, Lord Jesus, look down from the sky And stay by my cradle til morning is nigh.
hymns.Verse3: Be near me, Lord Jesus, I ask Thee to stay Close by me forever, and love me, I pray. Bless all the dear children in thy tender care, And take us to heaven, to live with Thee there.

hymns.Title: Joy to the World
hymns.Verse1: Joy to the world, the Lord is come! Let earth receive her King; Let every heart prepare Him room, And heaven and nature sing, And heaven and nature sing, And heaven, and heaven and nature sing.
hymns.Verse2: Joy to the earth, the Savior reigns! Let men their songs employ; While fields and floods, rocks, hills, and plains, Repeat the sounding joy, Repeat the sounding joy, Repeat, repeat the sounding joy.
hymns.Verse3: No more let sin and sorrow grow, Nor thorns infest the ground; He comes to make His blessings flow Far as the curse is found, Far as the curse is found, Far as, far as the curse is found.

hymns.Title: In the Bleak Midwinter
hymns.Verse1: In the bleak midwinter Frosty wind made moan; Earth stood hard as iron, Water like a stone; Snow had fallen, snow on snow, Snow on snow, In the bleak midwinter, Long ago.
hymns.Verse2: Angels and archangels May have gathered there, Cherubim and seraphim Thronged the air. But His mother only In her maiden bliss, Worshiped the beloved With a kiss.
hymns.Verse3: What can I give Him, Poor as I am? If I were a shepherd I would bring a lamb; If I were a wise man I would do my part; Yet what can I give Him? Give my heart.

hymns.Title: Infant Holy, Infant Lowly
hymns.Verse1: Infant holy, infant lowly, For His bed a cattle stall; Oxen lowing, little knowing Christ the babe is Lord of all; Swift are winging angels singing, Noels ringing, tidings bringing, Christ the babe is Lord of all, Christ the babe is Lord of all.
hymns.Verse2: Flocks were sleeping, shepherds keeping Vigil till the morning new; Saw the glory, heard the story, Tidings of the gospel true; Thus rejoicing, free from sorrow, Praising voicing greet the morrow, Christ the babe was born for you, Christ the babe was born for you.

hymns.Title: Break Forth, O Beauteous Heavenly Light
hymns.Verse1: Break forth, O beauteous heavenly light, And usher in the morning; Ye shepherds, shrink not with affright, But hear the angel's warning. This child, now weak in infancy Our confidence and joy shall be, The power of Satan breaking, Our peace eternal making.
hymns.Verse2: Break forth, O beauteous heavenly light, To herald our salvation; He stoops to earth the God of might, Our hope and expectation. He comes in human flesh to dwell, Our God with us, Immanuel, The night of darkness ending, Our fallen race befriending.

hymns.Title: Good Christian Friends, Rejoice!
hymns.Verse1: Good Christian friends, rejoice and sing! Now is the triumph of our King! To all the world glad news we bring: Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
hymns.Verse2: The Lord of life is risen for aye; Bring flowers of song to strew His way; Let all mankind rejoice and say: Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
hymns.Verse3: Praise we in songs of victory That love, that life which cannot die, And sing with hearts uplifted high: Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

hymns.Title: Star of Our Hope
hymns.Verse1: Star of our hope! He'll soon appear, The last loud trumpet speaks Him near; Hail Him, all saints, from pole to pole- How welcome to the faithful soul!
hymns.Verse2: From heaven angelic voices sound: Behold the Lord of glory crowned, Arrayed in majesty divine, And in His highest glories shine.
hymns.Verse3: The grave yields up its precious trust, Which long has slumbered in the dust, Resplendent forms ascending, fair, Now meet the Savior in the air.

hymns.Title: Now the Green Blade Rises
hymns.Verse1: Now the green blade rises from the buried grain, What that in dark earth many days has lain; Love lives again, that with the dead has been; Love is come again like wheat arising green.
hymns.Verse2: In the grave they laid Him, love by hatred slain, Thinking that He would never wake again, Laid in the earth like grain that sleeps unseen; Love is come again like wheat arising green.
hymns.Verse3: Forth He came in triumph, like the risen grain, He that for three days in the grave had lain; Raised from the dead, my living Lord is seen; Love is come again like wheat arising green.

hymns.Title: Hail the Day That Sees Him Rise
hymns.Verse1: Hail the day that sees Him rise, Alleluia! Glorious to His native skies; Alleluia! Christ, awhile to mortals giv'n, Alleluia! Enters now the highest heav'n! Alleluia!
hymns.Verse2: There the glorious triumph waits; Alleluia! Lift your heads, eternal gates! Alleluia! Wide unfold the radiant scene; Alleluia! Take the King of glory in! Alleluia!
hymns.Verse3: See! He lifts His hands above; Alleluia! See! He shows the prints of love: Alleluia! Hark! His gracious lips bestow, Alleluia! Blessings on His Church below. Alleluia!

hymns.Title: Jesus, Your Blood and Righteousness
hymns.Verse1: Jesus, your blood and righteousness My beauty are, my glorious dress; Mid flaming worlds, in these arrayed, With joy shall I lift up my head.
hymns.Verse2: Bold shall I stand in that great day, Cleansed and redeemed, no debt to pay; For by your cross absolved I am From sin and guilt, from fear and shame.
hymns.Verse3: Lord, I believe your precious blood, Which at the mercy seat of God Pleads for the captives' liberty, Was also shed in love for me.

hymns.Title: The Wonders of Redeeming Love
hymns.Verse1: The wonders of redeeming love Our highest thoughts exceed; The Son of God comes from above For sinful man to bleed.
hymns.Verse2: He gives Himself, His life, His all, A sinless sacrifice. For man He drains the cup of gall, For man the victim dies.
hymns.Verse3: And now before His Father's face His precious blood He pleads; For those who seek the throne of grace His love still intercedes.

hymns.Title: Does Jesus Care?
hymns.Refrain: O yes, He cares- I know He cares! His heart is touched with my grief; When the days are weary, The long nights dreary, I know my Savior cares. (He cares.)
hymns.Verse1: Does Jesus care when my heart is pained Too deeply for mirth and song; As the burdens press, and the cares distress, And the way grows weary and long?
hymns.Verse2: Does Jesus care when my way is dark With a nameless dread and fear? As the daylight fades into deep night shades, Does He care enough to be near?

hymns.Title: Christ Is Alive
hymns.Verse1: Christ is alive! Let Christians sing. His cross stands empty to the sky. Let streets and homes with praises ring. His love in death shall never die.
hymns.Verse2: Christ is alive! No longer bound To distant years in Palestine, He comes to claim the here and now And conquer every place and time.
hymns.Verse3: In every insult, rift, and war Where color, scorn or wealth divide, He suffers still, yet loves the more, And lives, though ever crucified.

hymns.Title: I Will Sing of Jesus' Love
hymns.Verse1: I will sing of Jesus love Endless praise my heart shall give; He has died that I might live I will sing His love to me.
hymns.Verse2: I Will sing of Jesus love, Sing of Him,who first loved me; for He left bright worlds above, And died on Calvary.
hymns.Verse3: O the depths of love divine! Earth or heaven can never know How that sin as dark as mine can be made as white as snow.

hymns.Title: Jesus Paid It All
hymns.Refrain: Jesus paid it all, All to Him I owe; Sin had left a crimson stain, He washed it white as snow.
hymns.Verse1: I hear the Savior say, 'Thy strength indeed is small; Child of weakness, watch and pray, Find in Me thine all in all.'
hymns.Verse2: Lord, now indeed I find Thy power and Thine alone, Can change the leper's spots And melt the heart of stone.

hymns.Title: Jesus Is All the World to Me
hymns.Verse1: Jesus is all the world to me, my life, my joy, my all; he is my strength from day to day, without him I would fall. When I am sad, to him I go, no other one can cheer me so; when I am sad, he makes me glad, he's my friend.
hymns.Verse2: Jesus is all the world to me, my friend in trials sore; I go to him for blessings, and he gives them o'er and o'er. He sends the sunshine and the rain, he sends the harvest's golden grain; sunshine and rain, harvest of grain, he's my friend.

hymns.Title: My Song Is Love Unknown
hymns.Verse1: My song is love unknown, My Savior's love to me, Love to the loveless shown That they might lovely be. O who am I that for my sake My Lord should take frail flesh and die?
hymns.Verse2: He came from His blest throne, Salvation to bestow, But men made strange, and none The longed for Christ would know. But O my Friend, my Friend indeed Who at my need His life did spend.

hymns.Title: O Shepherd Divine
hymns.Verse1: O Shepherd divine, I know Thou art mine; Thy search in the night was for me. This bleak world is cold, but warm is Thy fold; My Shepherd, I follow Thee.
hymns.Verse2: O Shepherd divine, I know Thou art mine; Thy great heart was broken for me. Thy grace and Thy law I picture in awe; They kissed upon Calvary.

hymns.Title: Savior, Teach Me
hymns.Verse1: Savior, teach me day by day, Love's sweet lesson to obey, Sweeter lesson cannot be, Loving Him who first loved me.
hymns.Verse2: Teach me I am not my own, I am Thine, and Thine alone; Thine to keep, to rule, to save From all sin that would enslave.

hymns.Title: Love Divine, All Loves Excelling
hymns.Verse1: Love divine, all loves excelling, joy of heaven, to earth come down; fix in us thy humble dwelling; all thy faithful mercies crown!
hymns.Verse2: Breathe, O breathe thy loving Spirit into every troubled breast! Let us all in thee inherit; let us find the promised rest.

hymns.Title: Sing We of the Modern City
hymns.Verse1: Sing we of the modern city, Scene alike of joy and stress; Sing we of its nameless people In their urban wilderness.
hymns.Verse2: In the city full of people, World of speed and hectic days, Christ is present, and among us; In the crowd we see Him stand.

hymns.Title: Showers of Blessing
hymns.Refrain: Showers of blessing, Showers of blessing we need; Mercy drops round us are falling, But for the showers we plead.
hymns.Verse1: "There shall be showers of blessing;" This is the promise of love; There shall be seasons refreshing, Sent from the Savior above.

hymns.Title: Tell Me the Old, Old Story
hymns.Refrain: Tell me the old, old story, tell me the old, old story, Tell me the old, old story, of Jesus and His love.
hymns.Verse1: Tell me the old, old story of unseen things above, Of Jesus and His glory, of Jesus and His love.

hymns.Title: The King of Love My Shepherd Is
hymns.Verse1: The King of love my Shepherd is, Whose goodness faileth never; I nothing lack if I am His, And He is mine forever.
hymns.Verse2: Perverse and foolish, oft I strayed, But yet in love He sought me, And on His shoulder gently laid, And home, rejoicing, brought me.

hymns.Title: The Head That Once Was Crowned
hymns.Verse1: The head that once was crowned with thorns Is crowned with glory now; A royal diadem adorns The mighty victor's brow.
hymns.Verse2: The joy of all who dwell above, The joy of all below, To whom He manifests His love, And grants His name to know.

hymns.Title: And Can It Be?
hymns.Refrain: Amazing love! How can it be that thou, my God, shouldst die for me?
hymns.Verse1: And can it be that I should gain an interest in the Savior's blood! Died he for me? who caused his pain! For me? who him to death pursued?

hymns.Title: The Lord Is Coming
hymns.Verse1: The Lord is coming, let this be The herald note of jubilee, The herald note of jubilee.
hymns.Verse2: The Lord is coming! sound it forth From east to west, from south to north; Speed on! speed on the tidings glad, That none who love Him may be sad.

hymns.Title: Come, Thou Long Expected Jesus
hymns.Verse1: Come, thou long expected Jesus! born to set thy people free; from our fears and sins release us, let us find our rest in thee.
hymns.Verse2: Born thy people to deliver, born a child and yet a King, born to reign in us forever, now thy gracious kingdom bring.

hymns.Title: Christ Is Coming
hymns.Verse1: Christ is coming! let creation Bid her groans and travail cease; Let the glorious proclamation Hope restore and faith increase;
hymns.Verse2: With that "blessed hope" before us, Let no harp remain unstrung; Let the mighty advent chorus Onward roll from tongue to tongue:

hymns.Title: This Is the Threefold Truth
hymns.Verse1: Christ had died! Christ has risen! Christ will come again!
hymns.Verse2: This is the threefold truth On which our faith depends; And with this joyful cry Worship begins and ends.

hymns.Title: Hail Him the King of Glory
hymns.Verse1: Hail Him the King of glory, Once the Lamb for sinners slain; Tell, tell the wondrous story, "Jesus comes to reign."
hymns.Verse2: Nations again in strife and commotion, Warnings by the way; Signs in the heavens, unerring omens, Herald the glorious day.

hymns.Title: Gleams of the Golden Morning
hymns.Verse1: O, we see the gleams of the golden morning piercing thro' this night of gloom! O, see the gleams of the golden morning that will burst the tomb.
hymns.Verse2: The golden morning is fast approaching; Jesus soon will come To take his faithful and happy children to their promised home.

hymns.Title: Face to Face
hymns.Verse1: Face to face shall I behold Him, Far beyond the starry sky; Face to face in all His glory I shall see Him by and by!
hymns.Verse2: Only faintly now I see Him, With the darkening veil between, But a blessed day is coming, When His glory shall be seen.

hymns.Title: It May Be at Morn
hymns.Refrain: O Lord Jesus, how long, how long Ere we shout the glad song? Christ returneth, Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Amen, Hallelujah! Amen.
hymns.Verse1: It may be at morn, when the day is awaking, When sunlight through darkness and shadow is breaking, That Jesus will come in the fullness of glory To receive from the world His own.

hymns.Title: Wake, Awake for the Night Is Flying
hymns.Verse1: Wake, awake, for night is flying, The watchmen on the heights are crying; Awake, Jerusalem, arise! Midnight's solemn hour is tolling,
hymns.Verse2: Zion hears the watchmen singing, Her heart with deep delight is springing, She wakes, she rises from her gloom; Forth her Bridegroom comes, all-glorious,

hymns.Title: That Glorious Day Is Coming
hymns.Verse1: That glorious day is coming, The hour is hastening on; Its radiant light is nearing, Far brighter than the sun;
hymns.Verse2: The saints, then all victorious Will go to meet their Lord; An earth both bright and glorious, Will then be their reward;

hymns.Title: There'll Be No Dark Valley
hymns.Refrain: To gather His loved ones home, To gather His loved ones home. There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes, To gather His loved ones home.
hymns.Verse1: There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes, There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes, There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes, To gather His loved ones home.
hymns.Verse2: There'll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes, There'll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes, There'll be a happy tomorrow when Jesus comes, To gather His loved ones home.

hymns.Title: Lo! He Comes
hymns.Verse1: Lo! He comes, with clouds descending, Once for favored sinners slain; Countless angels, Him attending, Swell the triumph of His train: Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Jesus comes, and comes to reign.
hymns.Verse2: Every eye shall now behold Him Robed in dreadful majesty! Those who set at nought and sold Him, Pierced, and nailed Him to the tree, Deeply wailing, Deeply wailing, Shall the true Mesiah see!

hymns.Title: 'Tis Almost Time for the Lord to Come
hymns.Verse1: O it must be the breaking of the day! O it must be the breaking of the day! The night is almost gone, The day is coming on; O it must be the breaking of the day!
hymns.Verse2: 'Tis almost time for the Lord to come, I hear the people say; The stars of heaven are growing dim, It must be the breaking of the day.

hymns.Title: We Have This Hope
hymns.Verse1: We have this hope that burns within our heart, Hope in the coming of the Lord. We have this faith that Christ alone imparts, Faith in the promise of His Word.
hymns.Verse2: We believe the time is here, When the nations far and near Shall awake, and shout and sing Hallelujah! Christ is King!

hymns.Title: Jesus Is Coming Again
hymns.Refrain: Coming again, coming again, Jesus is coming again!
hymns.Verse1: Lift up the trumpet, and loud let it ring: Jesus is coming again! Cheer up, ye pilgrims, be joyful and sing: Jesus is coming again!
hymns.Verse2: Heavings of earth, tell the vast, wondering throng: Jesus is coming again! Tempests and whirlwinds, the anthem prolong; Jesus is coming again!

hymns.Title: The King Shall Come
hymns.Verse1: The King shall come when morning dawns And light triumphant breaks, When beauty gilds the eastern hills And life to joy awakes.
hymns.Verse2: O, brighter than the rising morn When Christ, victorious, rose And left the lonesome place of death, Despite the rage of foes.

hymns.Title: When He Cometh
hymns.Verse1: Like the stars of the morning, His brightness adorning, They shall shine in their beauty, Bright gems for His crown.
hymns.Verse2: He will gather, He will gather The gems for His kingdom; All the pure ones, all the bright ones, His loved and His own.

hymns.Title: When the Roll Is Called Up Yonder
hymns.Refrain: When the roll is called up yonder, When the roll is called up yonder, When the roll is called up yonder, When the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.
hymns.Verse1: When the trumpet of the Lord shall sound, and time shall be no more, And the morning breaks, eternal, bright and fair; When the saved of earth shall gather over on the other shore, And the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.

hymns.Title: O Worship the Lord
hymns.Verse1: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness, Bow down before Him, His glory proclaim; With gold of obedience, and incense of lowliness, Kneel and adore Him: the Lord is His name.
hymns.Verse2: Fear not to enter His courts in the slenderness Of the poor wealth thou wouldst reckon as thine; Truth in its beauty, and love in its tenderness, These are the offerings to lay on His shrine.

hymns.Title: All Creatures of Our God and King
hymns.Refrain: Oh, praise Him! Oh, praise Him! Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!
hymns.Verse1: All creatures of our God and King, Lift up your voice with us and sing: Alleluia! Alleluia! O burning sun with golden beam And silver moon with softer gleam:
hymns.Verse2: O flowing waters, pure and clear, Make music for your Lord to hear. Oh praise Him! Alleluia! O fire so masterful and bright, Providing us with warmth and light.

hymns.Title: I Think When I Read That Sweet Story
hymns.Verse1: I think when I read that sweet story of old, When Jesus was here among men, How He called little children as lambs to His fold, I should like to have been with Him then.
hymns.Verse2: I long for the joy of that glorious time, The sweetest and brightest and best, When the dear little children of every clime Shall crowd to His arms and be blest.

hymns.Title: Hover O'er Me, Holy Spirit
hymns.Refrain: Fill me now, fill me now, Jesus, come and fill me now. Fill me with Thy hallowed presence, Come, O come and fill me now.
hymns.Verse1: Hover o'er me, Holy Spirit, Bathe my trembling heart and brow; Fill me with Thy hallowed presence, Come, O come and fill me now.

hymns.Title: The Old Rugged Cross
hymns.Refrain: So I'll cherish the old rugged cross, till my trophies at last I lay down; I will cling to the old rugged cross, and exchange it some day for a crown.
hymns.Verse1: On a hill far away stood an old rugged cross, the emblem of suffering and shame; and I love that old cross where the dearest and best for a world of lost sinners was slain.

hymns.Title: O Sacred Head Now Wounded
hymns.Verse1: O sacred Head, now wounded, with grief and shame weighed down, now scornfully surrounded with thorns, thine only crown: how pale thou art with anguish, with sore abuse and scorn! How does that visage languish which once was bright as morn!
hymns.Verse2: What thou, my Lord, has suffered was all for sinners' gain; mine, mine was the transgression, but thine the deadly pain. Lo, here I fall, my Savior! 'Tis I deserve thy place; look on me with thy favor, vouchsafe to me thy grace.

hymns.Title: Wondrous Love
hymns.Verse1: What wondrous love is this, O my soul, O my soul? What wondrous love is this, O my soul? What wondrous love is this That caused the Lord of bliss To bear the dreadful curse for my soul, for my soul; To bear the dreadful curse for my soul.
hymns.Verse2: To God and to the Lamb I will sing, I will sing; To God and to the Lamb, I will sing; To God and to the Lamb Who is the great I am, While millions join the theme, I will sing, I will sing; While millions join the theme, I will sing.

hymns.Title: Were You There?
hymns.Verse1: Were you there when they crucified my Lord? Were you there when they crucified my Lord? O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble. Were you there when they crucified my Lord?
hymns.Verse2: Were you there when they nailed Him to the tree? Were you there when they nailed Him to the tree? O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble. Were you there when they nailed Him to the tree?

hymns.Title: Ride On in Majesty
hymns.Verse1: Ride on! ride on in majesty! Hark, all the tribes hosanna cry; O Savior meek, pursue Thy road With palms and scattered garments strowed.
hymns.Verse2: Ride on! ride on in majesty! In lowly pomp ride on to die; O Christ, Thy triumphs now begin O'er captive death and conquered sin.

hymns.Title: Throned Upon the Awful Tree
hymns.Verse1: Throned upon the awful tree, Lamb of God, Your grief we see. Darkness veils Your anguished face; None its lines of woe can trace. None can tell what pangs unknown Hold You silent and alone.
hymns.Verse2: Hark, that cry that peals aloud Upward through the whelming cloud! You, the Father's only Son, You, His own anointed one, You are asking- can it be? "Why have You forsaken Me?"

hymns.Title: At the Cross
hymns.Refrain: At the cross, at the cross, where I first saw the light, and the burden of my heart rolled away; it was there by faith I received my sight, and now I am happy all the day!
hymns.Verse1: Alas! and did my Savior bleed, and did my Sovereign die? Would he devote that sacred head for sinners such as I?

hymns.Title: There Is a Green Hill Far Away
hymns.Verse1: There is a green hill far away, Without a city wall, Where the dear Lord was crucified, Who died to save us all.
hymns.Verse2: He died that we might be forgiven, He died to make us good, That we might go at last to heaven, Saved by His precious blood.

hymns.Title: Go to Dark Gethsemane
hymns.Verse1: Go to dark Gethsemane, Ye who feel the tempter's power Your Redeemer's conflict see. Watch with Him one bitter hour; Turn not from His griefs away; Learn from Jesus Christ to pray.
hymns.Verse2: Calvary's mournful mountain climb; There, adoring at His feet, Mark that miracle of time, God's own sacrifice complete. "It is finished!" hear Him cry; Learn from Jesus Christ to die.

hymns.Title: Fire of God, Thou Sacred Flame
hymns.Verse1: Fire of God, Thou sacred flame, Spirit who in splendor came, Let Thy heat my soul refine Till it glows with love divine.
hymns.Verse2: Truth of God, Thy piercing rays Penetrate my secret ways. May the light that shames my sin Guide me holier paths to win.
